data.enText: crept
crept

data.chText: 悄悄地缓慢行进；蹑手蹑脚地移动
data.enText: to move slowly, quietly and carefully, because you do not want to be seen or heard

data.chText: 为了尽量不吵醒父母，我蹑手蹑脚地上了楼。
data.enText: I crept up the stairs, trying not to wake my parents.

data.chText: 匍匐；爬行
data.enText: to move with your body close to the ground; to move slowly on your hands and knees

data.chText: 非常缓慢地行进；不知不觉产生；渐渐出现
data.enText: to move or develop very slowly

data.chText: 她的双臂慢慢地搂住了他的脖子。
data.enText: Her arms crept around his neck.

data.chText: 我渐渐地产生了一丝疑虑。
data.enText: A slight feeling of suspicion crept over me.

data.chText: 蔓生；蔓延
data.enText: to grow along the ground or up walls using long stems or roots

data.chText: 谄媚；巴结；拍马屁
data.enText: to be too friendly or helpful to sb in authority in a way that is not sincere, especially in order to get an advantage from them
make your flesh creep

data.chText: 使起鸡皮疙瘩；令人毛骨悚然；使人十分厌恶
data.enText: to make you feel afraid or full of disgust
creep in/into sth

data.chText: 开始发生（或影响）
data.enText: to begin to happen or affect sth

data.chText: 由于越来越疲劳，她的工作开始出现差错。
data.enText: As she became more tired, errors began to creep into her work.
creep up

data.chText: （数量、价格等）逐渐增长
data.enText: to gradually increase in amount, price, etc.

data.chText: 住房价格又在渐渐上涨。
data.enText: House prices are creeping up again.
creep up on sb

data.chText: （通常从后面）缓慢地悄悄靠近
data.enText: to move slowly nearer to sb, usually from behind, without being seen or heard

data.chText: 别那样蹑手蹑脚地靠近我！
data.enText: Don't creep up on me like that!

data.chText: （尤指不知不觉地）开始影响（某人）
data.enText: to begin to affect sb, especially before they realize it

data.chText: 开车时会很容易不知不觉地就累了。
data.enText: Tiredness can easily creep up on you while you're driving.

data.chText: 讨厌鬼
data.enText: a person that you dislike very much and find very unpleasant

data.chText: 他真让人讨厌！
data.enText: He's a nasty little creep!

data.chText: 讨好卖乖的人；谄媚奉承的人；马屁精
data.enText: a person who is not sincere but tries to win your approval by being nice to you
give sb the creeps

data.chText: 吓人；使惊慌；使心里发毛
data.enText: to make sb feel nervous and slightly frightened, especially because sb/sth is unpleasant or strange

ex.zh: 蹑手蹑脚地移向；慢慢移向

data.enText: make your flesh creep

data.chText: 使起鸡皮疙瘩；令人毛骨悚然；使人十分厌恶
data.enText: to make you feel afraid or full of disgust
give sb the creeps

data.chText: 吓人；使惊慌；使心里发毛
data.enText: to make sb feel nervous and slightly frightened, especially because sb/sth is unpleasant or strange
creep in/into sth

data.chText: 开始发生（或影响）
data.enText: to begin to happen or affect sth

data.chText: 由于越来越疲劳，她的工作开始出现差错。
data.enText: As she became more tired, errors began to creep into her work.
creep up

data.chText: （数量、价格等）逐渐增长
data.enText: to gradually increase in amount, price, etc.

data.chText: 住房价格又在渐渐上涨。
data.enText: House prices are creeping up again.
creep up on sb

data.chText: （通常从后面）缓慢地悄悄靠近
data.enText: to move slowly nearer to sb, usually from behind, without being seen or heard

data.chText: 别那样蹑手蹑脚地靠近我！
data.enText: Don't creep up on me like that!

data.chText: （尤指不知不觉地）开始影响（某人）
data.enText: to begin to affect sb, especially before they realize it

data.chText: 开车时会很容易不知不觉地就累了。
data.enText: Tiredness can easily creep up on you while you're driving.

trans: （感觉或状态）不知不觉地开始影响（某人），不知不觉地产生

tr: a slow mode of locomotion on hands and knees or dragging the body
example: a crawl was all that the injured man could manage
the traffic moved at a creep

tr: a pen that is fenced so that young animals can enter but adults cannot
a slow longitudinal movement or deformation
in the case of people or animals with the body near the ground
example: The crocodile was crawling along the riverbed
..stead of sneaking around spying on the neighbor's house

tr: grow or spread, often in such a way as to cover (a surface)
example: ivy crept over the walls of the university buildings

value.def: When people or animals creep somewhere, they move quietly and slowly.

example.ex: Back I go to the hotel and creep up to my room...
example.tran: 我回到旅馆，蹑手蹑脚地上楼回到房间。

example.ex: The rabbit creeps away and hides in a hole.
example.tran: 兔子悄悄溜走，藏进洞里。

value.tran: (人或动物)悄悄地缓慢行进，蹑手蹑脚地移动

value.def: If something creeps somewhere, it moves very slowly.

example.ex: Mist had crept in again from the sea.
example.tran: 薄雾又从海面上弥漫过来了。

value.def: If something creeps in or creeps back, it begins to occur or becomes part of something without people realizing or without them wanting it.

example.tran: 可能会不知不觉地产生不安全感。

example.ex: An increasing ratio of mistakes, perhaps induced by tiredness, crept into her game.
example.tran: 可能是由于体力不支，她在比赛中的失误越来越多。

example.ex: ...a proposal that crept through unnoticed at the National Council in December...
example.tran: 一项于12月份在全国委员会不声不响获得通过的提议

example.ex: Now his other major works are creeping back into concert programmes...
example.tran: 现在他的其他主要作品又悄然出现在音乐会节目单上。

example.ex: Their organisation has been subjected to creeping privatisation since 1981.
example.tran: 自1981年以来他们的组织已经被逐渐私有化了。

value.def: If a rate or number creeps up to a higher level, it gradually reaches that level.

example.ex: The inflation rate has been creeping up to 9.5 per cent...
The average number of students in each class is creeping up from three to four.
example.tran: 每个班的平均学生人数已经从3人增长到了4人。

value.def: If you describe someone as a creep, you mean that you dislike them a great deal, especially because they are insincere and flatter people.
value.tran: 讨厌鬼; (尤指)讨好卖乖的人，马屁精

value.def: If someone or something gives you the creeps, they make you feel very nervous or frightened.

example.ex: I always hated that statue. It gave me the creeps.
example.tran: 我一直都很讨厌那座雕像。它让我心里发毛。

value.tran: 吓人;使惊慌;使心里发毛

trans: 抗蠕变性；蠕变强度；抗蠕阻力；蠕变阻力
蠕变特性；蠕变性能；蠕变性；蠕变性质
蠕变强度；潜伸强度；潜变强度
